This light field contains only orthogonal (parallel) viewing projections. The projections are equally distributed within a fiew of view of 10 degrees.


In particular, the views were rendered with the following camera parameters:


FILE	ANGLE X [deg]	ANGLE Y [deg]	ANGLE X [rel]	ANGLE Y [rel]

01	-5.000000	5.000000	-0.087489	0.087489
02	-3.338039	5.000000	-0.058326	0.087489
03	-1.670437	5.000000	-0.029163	0.087489
04	0.000000	5.000000	0.000000	0.087489
05	1.670437	5.000000	0.029163	0.087489
06	3.338039	5.000000	0.058326	0.087489
07	5.000000	5.000000	0.087489	0.087489
08	-5.000000	3.338039	-0.087489	0.058326

11	0.000000	3.338039	0.000000	0.058326
12	1.670437	3.338039	0.029163	0.058326

49	5.000000	-5.000000	0.087489	-0.087489



Note: I use the relative v parameterization in all of my code; here, v is a relative distance from the x position on a plane at unit distance, i.e. v=tan(theta) (where theta is the angle in degrees).
